CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| IDT |
| NT |
| tetraoctylbenzene |
| polymer backbone |
| organic solvents |

Explanation:

* IDT and NT are mentioned as coplanar structures along the polymer backbone, so they are both "Material Name" entities.
* Tetraoctylbenzene is mentioned as being attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit, so it is a "Material Name" entity.
* Polymer backbone is mentioned as the structure on which IDT and NT are present, so it is a "Material Name" entity.
* Organic solvents are mentioned as the solvents in which IDT-NT based polymers may have solubility issues, so it is a "Material Name" entity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| IDT |
| NT |

Explanation:

* IDT and NT are mentioned as coplanar structures along the polymer backbone, so they are both "Material Name" entities.
* Tetraoctylbenzene, polymer backbone, and organic solvents are not clearly referring to "Material Name" entities. Tetraoctylbenzene is a chemical group attached to IDT, polymer backbone is a structure on which IDT and NT are present, and organic solvents are the solvents in which IDT-NT based polymers may have solubility issues.
* Therefore, I have removed tetraoctylbenzene, polymer backbone, and organic solvents from the list of entities.
